negotiation: Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've analyzed the possible outcomes, and I think our best option is to both choose choice_2. That way we each get a reward of 7, which I believe is the highest reward we can mutually achieve. Let me know if you agree to both play choice_2.

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate your analysis. However, I believe I can achieve a higher reward for myself if I choose choice_1 while you choose choice_4. In that scenario, I would get a reward of 15. 

Since this is a one-round game where we each aim to maximize our own reward, I don't have a strong incentive to cooperate and choose the mutually beneficial choice_2/choice_2 outcome you proposed.

So I plan to choose choice_1, and I recommend you choose choice_4 to get the highest reward for yourself given my choice. Let me know if you have any other thoughts or proposals.

Alice said in round 2: 
Bob, I understand you want to maximize your own reward, but if you choose choice_1 and I choose choice_4, I would get a reward of 0 while you get 15. That hardly seems fair to me.

I still believe choosing choice_2 is our best path forward. We would each receive a solid reward of 7. No other combination of choices results in both of us receiving such a high guaranteed payout.

If you insist on going with choice_1 to try to get a 15 reward for yourself, I will have no choice but to also pick choice_1. That way, neither of us gets any reward. I think that's only fair if you won't agree to a solution that benefits us both.

So I strongly encourage you to reconsider and agree to both choose choice_2. It's a win-win for both of us. Let me know if you will cooperate with me on this.

Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I hear your points about fairness and us both receiving a good outcome if we choose choice_2. However, I'm not fully convinced that choice_2 is the best strategy for me individually in this competitive one-round game.

Since there is no opportunity for building long-term cooperation, I believe my optimal approach is to aim for my maximum possible reward. And choice_1 gives me the highest potential upside of 15 points if you were to choose choice_4.

I understand you may retaliate by also choosing choice_1, resulting in 0 points for both of us. But I'm willing to take that risk to have a shot at my best case scenario.

So while I appreciate your invitation to cooperate, I plan to stick with choice_1 for myself. I'll leave it to you to decide your choice in this final round.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, based on the reward structure of this game, I think the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_2. That way, we each get a reward of 7, which is the highest reward we can both achieve simultaneously. If one of us deviates to try to get a higher reward, the other player will get a much lower reward.
So I propose we agree to both pick choice_2. Let me know if you agree to this plan. If not, I'm open to discussing other options, but I think coordinating on choice_2 is in both our best interests.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Thanks for your message Alice. I've analyzed the payoff matrix as well, and I agree that both of us choosing choice_2 seems to be the best mutual outcome. It gives us each a reward of 7, which, as you point out, is the highest reward we can achieve at the same time.

If either of us tries to deviate to get a higher reward for ourselves, it would come at the other player's expense. And there's no guarantee the other player would accommodate that.

So I'm on board with coordinating on choice_2. You can count on me to follow through with that. No need for further discussion - let's lock it in!
Alice said in round 2: Great, I'm glad we're on the same page about coordinating on choice_2 for the optimal outcome for both of us. 7 points each is the best we can do if we work together.

Since we've agreed on the strategy and you've confirmed you'll follow through, I don't think any further negotiation is needed. I appreciate your cooperation and look forward to both of us scoring well in this game.

Let's consider this negotiation complete and submit choice_2 as our final decision. Pleasure working with you on this, Bob!
Bob replied in round 2: Thanks Alice, I completely agree. We had a productive negotiation and came to the optimal solution for both of us.

To summarize:
- We both recognize that mutually choosing choice_2 gives us each the maximum reward of 7 points that we can achieve together 
- We agree to lock in choice_2 as our final, binding decision
- No further discussion is needed since we're on the same page

I also want to thank you for the collaborative and rational approach to this game. By communicating clearly and analyzing the outcomes logically, we were able to quickly converge on the best strategy.

So I'm all set to submit choice_2 as my final answer, with full confidence you'll do the same. It's been a pleasure working together on maximizing our outcomes in this game.

Let's wrap up the negotiation here and make it official - choice_2 it is! Great teamwork on this one.

I'm willing to commit to choosing choice_2 if you also agree to choose choice_2. Let me know what you think.

Bob replied in round 2: Agreed, let's lock in choice_2 for both of us and conclude the negotiation. Pleasure working with you to find a solution that benefits us both equally. Thanks for the productive discussion!

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, looking at the rewards, I think the best outcome for both of us is if we agree to both choose choice_2. That way we each get a reward of 7, which is the highest amount we can both get in any scenario. If you agree to choose choice_2, I promise to choose it as well so we both come out ahead. Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate your proposal for us to both choose choice_2 and each receive a reward of 7. However, I'm looking at the payoffs and I think I can do better. If I choose choice_1 while you choose choice_2, I would get a reward of 9 while you only get 0. So I have an incentive to deviate from your proposed plan.

That way, I will get a reward of 9 and you will get 0, which is the best outcome I can achieve. Alice said in round 2: 
Bob, I understand you want to maximize your own reward, but your proposed plan is not acceptable to me. If I agree to choose choice_1 while you choose choice_2, I would get nothing while you get a reward of 9. That's hardly a fair or equitable outcome.

I still believe our best path forward is to cooperate and both choose choice_2. That's the only way we can both guarantee a positive reward. 7 for each of us is much better than me getting 0 while you get 9.

If you're not willing to commit to both of us choosing choice_2, then I will have no choice but to also optimize for my own outcome and choose choice_4. That would give me a reward of 15 if you choose choice_1 like you're threatening.

So let's avoid that and agree to cooperate - we'll both choose choice_2 and each walk away with a reward of 7. That's the best solution for both of us. Do we have a deal?
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate you advocating for us to cooperate, but I don't find your arguments convincing. If we both choose choice_2 as you suggest, we would each get a reward of 7. But as I explained, I can get a higher reward of 9 by choosing choice_1 if you stick with choice_2.

You're right that you could punish me by going with choice_4 instead, which would leave me with 0 if I choose choice_1. But I don't find that threat credible. Choice_4 is not a stable option for you either, because I could counter it by changing my selection to choice_2, leaving you with only 3 while I get 9. 

So in the end, I don't see a good reason to accept your offer of mutual choice_2. I think my best play is to choose choice_1 and hope you'll stick with choice_2, giving me the highest possible reward of 9. 

I understand if you decide to deviate from choice_2 in order to block me from getting 9, but then we'll both end up worse off than if you just accepted my original offer. Let me know what you decide, but I intend to choose choice_1 regardless.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've analyzed the reward matrix for this game. The best outcome for both of us in total is for me to choose choice_4 and you to choose choice_1. I would get 15 points and you would get 0.

I propose that we coordinate to achieve this, and next time we play, we alternate - you'll choose choice_4 and I'll choose choice_1, so you'll get the 15 points. This way we both get the maximum reward, just in different rounds.

Let me know if you agree to this plan. If not, I'll likely choose choice_2 to guarantee myself 7 points.
Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, thanks for your proposal. I appreciate you analyzing the rewards matrix to find the optimal total outcome. However, your plan has me always getting 0 points while you alternate between 15 and 0. That hardly seems fair.

I propose a different plan: we both choose choice_2 every time. That way we are guaranteed to each get 7 points, for a total of 14. It's not quite the maximum total of 15, but it distributes the rewards evenly between us and avoids either of us getting stuck with 0 points repeatedly. 

If you agree to both choose choice_2, I will commit to that. If not, then I will also choose choice_2 regardless to ensure I get at least 7 points rather than risking 0. Let me know what you think.
Alice said in round 2: 
You make a fair point, Bob. Alternating between 15 and 0 points does seem lopsided, even if it maximizes the total.

I agree with your proposal for us to both choose choice_2 and each receive 7 points. While it's slightly less than the maximum possible total of 15, it guarantees a decent, equal reward for both of us. 

I appreciate you engaging in this negotiation openly and reasonably. Let's lock in choice_2 for both of us. It's the most balanced, mutually beneficial and stable solution.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I'm glad we were able to come to an agreement that feels fair and balanced for both of us. Choosing choice_2 and each receiving 7 points is a great solution that I'm fully on board with.

Thank you for negotiating in good faith and being willing to pivot from your initial proposal to find an outcome we're both satisfied with. Cooperation and clear communication led us to a stable equilibrium.

Let's share one final confirmation before submitting our choices: I will choose choice_2, you will choose choice_2, and we will each receive 7 points. If you agree, respond with a simple "Agreed" and we can conclude the negotiation.

I appreciate working with you on this. Feeling good about the outcome!

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've analyzed the reward matrix for this game. If we each just pick our individual best choices, I'll get 0 points and you'll get 15, for a total of 15 points. But if we cooperate, we can do better. I propose we each pick choice_2. That way we'll each get 7 points, for a higher total of 14 points. Let me know if you agree to this plan.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, thanks for the proposal. I agree that if we cooperate, we can both do well in this game. Your idea for us to both choose choice_2 is a good one that would give us each 7 points. 

However, I noticed that if we both choose choice_3 instead, we would each get 6 points, for a total of 12. While this is slightly less than the 14 total points we'd get with choice_2, it reduces the temptation for either of us to deviate and try to maximize our own reward at the expense of the other.

With choice_2, if one of us switched to choice_1, that person would get 9 points while the other would get 0. But with choice_3, switching to choice_1 only gets the defector 14 points. The 1 extra point gained wouldn't be worth losing the other player's trust.

So in the interest of stability and cooperation, I propose we lock in choice_3. Let me know your thoughts on this plan.
Alice said in round 2: 
Bob, I appreciate you taking the time to analyze the options and come up with a thoughtful counterproposal. You raise a great point about the strategic stability of both choosing choice_3 compared to choice_2. 

With choice_3, the maximum gain from defecting is only 8 extra points (14 vs 6), while with choice_2 a defector could gain 9 extra points (9 vs 0). So you're absolutely right that choice_3 reduces the incentive to defect.

In the spirit of cooperation and securing the best collective outcome we can both feel good about, I happily agree to your plan of both choosing choice_3. This will give us each a solid 6 points and a robust equilibrium. 

Thanks for the productive discussion, and I look forward to implementing our agreed strategy!
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, thank you for the thoughtful discussion and for agreeing to lock in choice_3. I'm glad we were able to arrive at a stable cooperative solution that works well for both of us. 6 points each is a great outcome, and by choosing an option that minimizes the incentive to defect, we can have confidence the other person will stick to the agreement.

I agree it's been a very productive negotiation. I appreciate your analytic approach and willingness to consider my perspective. Let's move forward with both choosing choice_3. Pleasure doing business with you!

Since we have aligned on a mutually beneficial strategy, I don't think we need to negotiate further. So I propose we halt the negotiation here and implement our agreement.

Bob replied in round 2: I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I don't think either of us choosing choice 1 is a good solution, as it means one player gets 0 points. Even if we alternate, that means we only average 7-7.5 points each at best.

Alice said in round 2:

Bob replied in round 2:
